intro: Citharexylum hexangulare var. brevifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved citharexylum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Verbenaceae. It is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of fragrant, white to pale pink flowers. The plant is native to parts of Southeast Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. It has a compact growth habit and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant. Its foliage and flowers attract various pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance.
